resources.string: OOPS! This app is not available yet.

A new version is available. Would you like to update the application now?
The Smart Campus apps are built with students, by students, and for students of the University of Trento.
Smart Campus is an open source project realized by

To gain full access to all of the apps\' functions, you must give the University of Trento permission to release your data to Smart Campus.
To do so, go to this website, sign into your UniTn account, and fill out the form.
The wizard will guide you through the uninstallation procedure.\n\nDon\'t worry! Your data will be saved and retrieved once the new versions of the apps are installed.
An old version of the Smart Campus apps was found. For this new version to run properly you must uninstall any Smart Campus app that was previously installed.
Are you sure you want to exit? If you don\'t finish the wizard, you won\'t be able to use our apps.

The Trento Rise project "Smart Campus" ended officially on December 31st, 2014, but is still alive in the results it produced and disseminated in Trentino. Besides having had important research impacts, Smart Campus distributed over the territory a set of services that will not get lost but they will remain available on the Google and Apple marketplaces.

The services that have been most successful among the campus students will continue to live, hosted by the Smart Community project: "iFame" - created and produced entirely by students to better enjoy meals in the university canteens - and "ViaggiaTrento" - an app about sustainable mobility which is already widely used outside the campus. Other services, such as "StudyMate", "Inbox" and "ViviTrento" will follow shortly.

The Smart Campus project team wants to thank all those who contributed to the success of the project: first of all the real stars of the project, the students, who have contributed in various ways to achieve the expected results; but also our partners throughout the territory: Municipality of Trento, Consorzio dei Comuni, the Open Data Initiative of the Autonomous Province of Trento, ITT Marconi in Rovereto, ITI Buonarroti in Trento, Opera Universitaria, Trentino Trasporti Esercizio; without forgetting the institutes and associations that have allowed all this with their support: Trento Rise Association, University of Trento and Fondazione Bruno Kessler.
